body:
Hi Lambda, thanks for all of the comments!

Yes that is the correct algorithm. My code assumed a max of one hop which was okay since we only inferred ranges for tensors that we create internally within TF-TRT  (the user could always just provide a quantization node for everything else).

But I agree that we should be smarter about inferring to make this feature easier to use, so I will implement the multi-hop algorithm.
body_html:
Hi Lambda, thanks for all of the comments!

Yes that is the correct algorithm. My code assumed a max of one hop which was okay since we only inferred ranges for tensors that we create internally within TF-TRT (the user could always just provide a quantization node for everything else).

But I agree that we should be smarter about inferring to make this feature easier to use, so I will implement the multi-hop algorithm.
body_text:
Hi Lambda, thanks for all of the comments!
Yes that is the correct algorithm. My code assumed a max of one hop which was okay since we only inferred ranges for tensors that we create internally within TF-TRT  (the user could always just provide a quantization node for everything else).
But I agree that we should be smarter about inferring to make this feature easier to use, so I will implement the multi-hop algorithm.
